page.title: 01THE STUDY AREA
page.content: There are {two}main settlements in the area ,{Leyburn}and{Wensley. }Leyburn which was mentioned in the original Domesday Book is the bigger place but until the time of the plague Wensley was more important.Leyburn was granted a {Market Charter} in 1684.A large area of land is taken up by {farming.} There are quarries where {roadstone}is produced.Leyburn is situated at the junction of two main trunk routes-A684 which links the A1 with the M6 and-A6108 Richmond to Ripon route.There is a {railway}line running through the area used for trasporting limestone from Redmire quarry to the { {British Steel}works at Redcar.Many { {tourists}visit the area -the area became well known when a series of telivision films were made here "All Creatures Great and Small" from the James Herriott stories.
